an10.90:0.3: The Powers of One Who has Ended Defilements
an10.90:1.1: Then Venerable Sāriputta went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:
an10.90:1.2: “Sāriputta, how many powers does a mendicant who has ended the defilements have that qualify them to claim:
an10.90:2.1: “Sir, a mendicant who has ended the defilements has ten powers that qualify them to claim:
an10.90:2.4: Firstly, a mendicant with defilements ended has clearly seen with right wisdom all conditions as truly impermanent.
an10.90:2.5: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
an10.90:3.1: Furthermore, a mendicant with defilements ended has clearly seen with right wisdom that sensual pleasures are truly like a pit of glowing coals.
an10.90:3.2: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
an10.90:4.1: Furthermore, the mind of a mendicant with defilements ended slants, slopes, and inclines to seclusion. They’re withdrawn, loving renunciation, and they’ve totally done with defiling influences.
an10.90:4.2: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
an10.90:5.1: Furthermore, a mendicant with defilements ended has well developed the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
an10.90:5.2: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
an10.90:6.1: Furthermore, a mendicant with defilements ended has well developed the four right efforts. …
an10.90:6.2: the four bases of psychic power …
an10.90:6.7: This is a power that a mendicant who has ended the defilements relies on to claim:
an10.90:7.1: A mendicant who has ended the defilements has these ten powers that qualify them to claim:
